alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 1:28PM PST until January 21 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM FRIDAY TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY MONO COUNTY ABOVE 7500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT FOR MONO COUNTY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 7500 feet, snow. Snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, and 4 to 12 inches generally west of US-395. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph in valley locations, and gusts higher than 60 mph along the Sierra crest. For the Winter Storm Watch for Mono County above 7000 feet, heavy snow. Snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches generally west of US-395 and locally higher amounts up to 2 feet along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM Friday to 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the daily commutes through Monday night.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
